lender.name: krishnan

lender.name: Nickolas
lender.loan_because:
...the world is ready for change
When an entrepreneur has an unending desire to create something significant, great things can happen. When an entrepreneur's dream comes true, the dream affects many people.
A healthy business provides new jobs, new products, new conveniences, and the most important thing of all...inspiration to the people that it serves.
While not everyone has the ability to receive a loan through Kiva, I hope to support those who are trying to achieve their dreams.
Communicate with others respectfully. Keep your business vision powerful and recite it often. Create a plan, make long-lasting business relationships, and empower your team to work within the system you have designed.
Decide today that you will succeed and Kiva will be there to help you when the time is right.
lender.occupational_info: web, software, and media

lender.name: Drew
lender.loan_because: I care about seeing justice in our world and this is the best way I can think of right now to share the abundance that I've been given.

I still roll over my repayment money... for now.

lender.occupational_info: I co-host a morning radio show from 5:30-10am CST. Listen online at b933fm.com We play music from bands like "Journey" and "Genesis" and artists like Taylor Swift and K.T. Tunstell. Our show also has guests, call in segments, news and traffic reports.

PALESTINE: THE WORLD'S NEXT NATION:
www.avaaz.org/en/independence_for_palestine_9/?fp
"Posted: 1 August 2011 In five days the UN Security Council will meet, and the world has an opportunity to embrace a new proposal that could turn the tide on decades of failed Israeli-Palestinian peace talks: UN recognition of the state of Palestine.
Over 120 nations from the Middle East, Africa, Asia, and Latin America have already endorsed this initiative, but Israel's right-wing government and the US vehemently oppose it. Europe is still undecided, but a massive public push now could tip key countries to vote for this momentous opportunity to end the occupation.
US-led peace initiatives have failed for decades, while Israel has confined the Palestinian people, confiscated their lands and blocked Palestine from becoming a sovereign political entity. This bold new initiative could be a game changer, but Europe must take the lead. Letâs build a massive global call for key European leaders to endorse this statehood bid now, and make clear that citizens across the world support this legitimate, non-violent, diplomatic proposal. Sign the petition and send this to everyone":
www.avaaz.org/en/independence_for_palestine_9/?fp
SIGN THE PETITION:
"To the leaders of France, Spain, Germany, the UK and the High Representative of the EU and all UN member states: We urge you to endorse the legitimate bid for recognition of the state of Palestine and the reaffirmation of the rights of the Palestinian people. It is time to turn the tide on decades of failed peace talks, end the occupation and move towards peace based on two states."
www.avaaz.org/en/independence_for_palestine_9/?fp

18 April 2011 | ISM GAZA "Following the murder of our comrade and friend Viktor, we, activists of the International Solidarity Movement, would like to reiterate our commitment to remaining in Gaza. We will continue to work with and live among the Palestinian population as we continue the work which Vik was so committed too. palsolidarity.org/
www.closedzone.com/
BREAK THE SIEGE ON GAZA!!!: The siege on Gaza "punish innocent civilians with the goal of exerting pressure on the Hamas government, violating the rights of 1.5 million people who seek only to live ordinary lives â to be reunited with family, to pursue higher education, to receive quality medical treatment, and to earn a living." www.closedzone.com/
www.unrwa.org/ United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA)
The blockhade:
06 July 2010 "Thousands missing out on education in Gaza" "Thousands of Palestinian refugee children in the Gaza strip are unable to receive adequate education, according to the UNRWA.Â About 39,000 thousand child refugees in Gaza will not attend UNRWA schools this year, since the Agency is unable to build or rebuild schools due to the Israeli blockhade, damage sustained during the 23-day Israeli offensive (27 December 2008 - 18 January 2009) and population growth, UNRWA spokesperson Chris Gunness said." @www.unrwa.org/etemplate.php?id=731Â
18 March 2010
"A new project by the United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) aims to build around 120 mud-brick houses for dozens of homeless Gazan families in the next few months. Each house costs about US$10,000 and takes three months to build." @www.unrwa.org/tags.php?tag_id=44
18 March 2009 "More than 4,036 houses in the Gaza Strip were totally destroyed or damaged beyond repair in Israelâs 23-day military conflict in late 2008 and early 2009. Rebuilding these homes has been almost impossible because Israel has not allowed cement and building materials into Gaza since June 2007, saying they could be used for military purposes. ..." @www.unrwa.org/etemplate.php?id=633

lender.loan_because: I want to help people help themselves and others as Jesus Christ would do. Teach a man to fish...
lender.occupational_info: I own assisted care housing for the American elderly. We provide a fun place to live, good food, and good friends.

lender.name: Jim, Kathy, Liv, Eamon
lender.loan_because: To show my kids that giving a small amount of money can make a big difference in people's lives around the world.
lender.occupational_info: criminal defense lawyer, nurse practitioner, students

lender.name: Dan
lender.loan_because: I am an entrepreneur myself and I love to help others get off the ground and running.
lender.occupational_info: I help people buy and sell their small to medium sized businesses here in the United States.

lender.name: Helena
lender.loan_because: Pay it forward

lender.name: John & Mattie
lender.loan_because: It's great to feel connected to people around the world.

lender.name: Julie
lender.loan_because: I liked to give to women to give them opportunity to be empowered to start and grow a business.
lender.occupational_info: I manage a program of 40 child development centers, a nutrition program, 75 family child care homes, early intervention services for children disabled and mental health services for families and children.

lender.name: Ken
lender.loan_because: I can't think of a better way to give a little back to all the wonderful people around the world.

lender.name: Jean K
lender.loan_because: I don't want to ever forget that although times are tough in the US, we live better than many other people in the world. We need to take care of each other. One person can't do it all so I do what I can.
lender.occupational_info: I work in a hospital with medical records. I review them to make sure we have the necessary information so that the insurance companies pay the bill, and assign diagnosis codes.

lender.name: David & Kelley
lender.loan_because: Kiva is the perfect opportunity to teach my nephew that the world is filled with people who need our help and how important it is to give it.

lender.name: T. Hans
lender.loan_because: Jesus is Lord! I am a Bread for the World member and am concerned about global hunger and poverty. Love & Peace!
lender.occupational_info: The Change Agent

lender.name: DHEERAJ
lender.loan_because: Trying to make a difference in someone's life.

lender.name: Eric and Brita
lender.loan_because: It is good to be generous

lender.name: Vanessa
lender.loan_because: Its the right thing to do.
lender.occupational_info: I create and maintain databases

lender.name: Brendan
lender.loan_because: Small streams become mighty rivers.
lender.occupational_info: I'm just an average guy, happily married with three kids. I'm originally from Dublin but live up North now.

lender.name: Allee
lender.loan_because: I care about others and want to give people a chance for a better life.
lender.occupational_info: I am proud to be a part of the human race and it is a wonderful thing if you can help someone in need. Always give more then you get and remember where you came from and who loves you!

lender.name: Jim
lender.loan_because: Capitalism is morally right, which is why it works so well.

lender.name: Tejal
lender.loan_because: Kiva, its field partners, and clients are making it happen!
lender.occupational_info: Doing a small part to help Kiva further its mission.

lender.name: Deolinda
lender.loan_because: Hello my name us Deolinda Oliveira. I am Portuguese and heard about you on TV, and this means I ask for your help. I am divorced.I am 44 years, I have a maid salary of 500 â¬. I have a housing credit in the bank Caixa Geral de Depositos from 500 â¬ obviously can not pay the entire benefit, has repeatedly have asked me to drop the provision and has not been able to do this, do not fall I ask if you can help me it does not want to lose my house, and heard the story qu great people has helped you please help me. Thank you for this time. I look forward with the best response lengths Deolinda Oliveira Contact: 912181851

lender.name: Cecilia
lender.loan_because: I want to feel connected with hardworking enterpreneurs all over the world. I love to think that a small loan from me can lift an entire family out of poverty.
lender.occupational_info: I am a nurse and a researcher. I help nurses provide the very best possible care to patients and their family members

lender.name: Victoria
lender.occupational_info: Student.

lender.name: Dave & Gin
lender.loan_because: I want to help others in less fortunate situations improve their lives and the communities they live in.
lender.occupational_info: I am a student at CSUEB, currently studying bus. I work part time with Primerica a finical solutions company for the working class.

lender.name: Diana B Sierra
lender.loan_because: Is important to help others reach their potential
lender.occupational_info: I work as a design consultant helping people developing ideas from concept to product.

lender.name: Terry
lender.loan_because: My family and I are fortunate to have many resources available to us. I want other parents to have the same opportunity to provide for their children.

lender.name: Stuart
lender.loan_because: Seems the right thing to do.
lender.occupational_info: Consultant. Geographic Information Systems and Offshore Survey

lender.name: Maggie
lender.loan_because: I loan because everyone deserves a chance regardless of the situation they were born into. Great ideas come from millions of people and ideas have never had land or financial boundariers. Kiva also gives me the opportunity to teach my daughter how to make a difference that counts.
lender.occupational_info: I focus on finding holes in markets no matter how small and then I decide if I want to fill those holes.

lender.name: Ryan Montgomery
lender.loan_because: I care.
lender.occupational_info: I make websites.

lender.name: Maggie
lender.loan_because: It is an easy way for me to help others. I love that once the loan is repaid I can use that same money to help even more people.
lender.occupational_info: I am a full time student and single mom. I plan to teach high school English.

lender.name: Lyn
lender.loan_because: I'm blessed to live where I do, with a good job. Loaning a small amount can make such a huge difference to a person, and make their lives so much better - why would I NOT loan?
lender.occupational_info: I work in a library, helping people find the information they need and making sure they go away with what they wanted when they came in.

lender.name: rvg
lender.loan_because: it can be the answer someone is hoping for, in order to continue/grow their business and get ahead in life.
lender.occupational_info: Managing Software Product Development

lender.name: Andrea
lender.loan_because: It's a small step toward making a big difference in the world.

lender.name: Robert
lender.loan_because: Everyone needs a boost up sometime and I can help.
lender.occupational_info: I am a retired law enforcement professional, both city and county. I now enjoy my retirement by traveling and working Amateur radio from my home.

lender.name: Emily
lender.loan_because:
Love is louder.
Be the change you want to see in the world.

lender.name: Ella
lender.loan_because: my grandparents gave me money to donate to the charity of my choice.

lender.name: Christian
lender.loan_because:
People in different countries should connect and work together through the internet to accomplish common goals.
Also because it is a good investment and I know that Kiva enterpreneurs will use the money wisely.

lender.name: Susanna
lender.loan_because:
It's a small thing - just $25 to assist another woman to make a better life for herself and her family.
In the normal course of events I would never even know of these women and how they courageously struggle to raise themselves from poverty.
lender.occupational_info:
OK, so I can't change the world. I would prefer if all the war budgets aimed at slaughtering each other were used instead to create a world where everyone had proper food, housing, education and health care. A world where social justice for all was the norm. But it's not.
Making a micro loan through Kiva is one small action I can take. One thing I CAN do.
I'm a member of the Red Hats on the Yarra group, we make loans to women who don't have the resources which we take for granted.
Do yourself a favour and join us. You don't have to be a Red Hatter, you don't even have to live in Melbourne! All you need is a heart - and the vision to see that Kiva is NOT a charity but a self-help scheme.

lender.name: Vyshali
lender.loan_because: some people just need someone to believe in them.

lender.name: Alfredo
lender.loan_because: I want to be of help to others as I can

lender.name: BÃ©atrice
lender.loan_because: I think it's right to help when we can and we want do it.
lender.occupational_info: the creation change every day, and need to adapt your mind and your taste around the shape you have to work...like in the life.

lender.name: Fabienne
lender.loan_because: I loan because I care! It's the most amazing thing to know that I can help someone to have a better life!

lender.name: Kimberly
lender.loan_because: the gratification I get from helping a person provide for not only themselves but future generations is worth more than any amount of money.
lender.occupational_info: I teach people how to do every day tasks (bathing, dressing, eatting) after being sick and weak.

lender.name: Zbyszek
lender.occupation: Supervisors elderly and the sick people

lender.name: Denise
lender.loan_because: I like to help others.
lender.occupational_info: I grow plants for sale.

lender.name: Paula
lender.loan_because: I can, I went through some bad points myself so I know how helpful and important it is to help someone, even if it's only a small amount... someone's 20 bucks saved my butt... so I'm passing it on...
lender.occupational_info: It's complicated, I do many things to survive. I help others with my time and money. Mostly my time because I don't have much money myself.
